Welcome to Pyeo’s documentation!¶

Indices and tables¶

  • Index
  • Module Index
  • Search Page

Introduction¶

Python For Earth Observation is a collection of functions for downloading, manipulating, combining and classifying geospatial raster and vector data. It is intended to require a minimum of dependencies - most functions only require the basic GDAL/OGR/OSR stack.

Installation¶

With Git installed, cd to an install location then run the following lines

git clone https://github.com/clcr/pyeo.git
cd pyeo
python setup.py install

If you want to edit this code, run

python setup.py devel

instead of install

To verify the installation, open a Python prompt and type

>>> import pyeo

You should get no errors.

Function reference¶

At present, all processing code is located in pyeo/core.py. A small test suite is located in pyeo/tests/pyeo_tests.py; this is designed for use with py.test. Some example applications and demos are in pyeo/apps; for an illustration of the use of the library, pyeo/apps/change_detection/simple_s2_change_detection.py is recommended.

File structure and logging¶

pyeo.core.init_log(log_path)¶

Sets up the log format and log handlers; one for stdout and to write to a file, ‘log_path’. Returns the log for the calling script

pyeo.core.create_file_structure(root)¶

Creates the file structure if it doesn’t exist already

pyeo.core.read_aoi(aoi_path)¶

Opens the geojson file for the aoi. If FeatureCollection, return the first feature.

Sentinel 2 data acquisition¶

pyeo.core.check_for_new_s2_data(aoi_path, aoi_image_dir, conf)¶

Checks the S2 API for new data; if it’s there, return the result

pyeo.core.download_new_s2_data(new_data, aoi_image_dir)¶

Downloads new imagery from AWS. new_data is a dict from Sentinel_2

pyeo.core.sent2_query(from geospatial_learn)¶

From Geospatial Learn by Ciaran Robb, embedded here for portability.

A convenience function that wraps sentinelsat query & download

I have found the sentinesat sometimes fails to download the second image, so I have written some code to avoid this - choose api = False for this

user : string
username for esa hub
passwd : string
password for hub
geojsonfile : string
AOI polygon of interest
start_date : string
date of beginning of search
end_date : string
date of end of search
output_folder : string
where you intend to download the imagery
cloud : string (optional)
include a cloud filter in the search

Planet data acquisition¶

pyeo.core.planet_query(aoi_path, start_date, end_date, out_path, api_key, item_type='PSScene4Band', search_name='auto', asset_type='analytic', threads=5)¶

Downloads data from Planetlabs for a given time period in the given AOI

aoi : str
Filepath of a single-polygon geojson containing the aoi
start_date : str
the inclusive start of the time window in UTC format
end_date : str
the inclusive end of the time window in UTC format
out_path : filepath-like object
A path to the output folder Any identically-named imagery will be overwritten
item_type : str
Image type to download (see Planet API docs)
search_name : str
A name to refer to the search (required for large searches)
asset_type : str
Planet asset type to download (see Planet API docs)
threads : int
The number of downloads to perform concurrently

IMPORTANT: Will not run for searches returning greater than 250 items.

pyeo.core.build_search_request(aoi, start_date, end_date, item_type, search_name)¶

Builds a search request for the planet API

pyeo.core.do_quick_search(session, search_request)¶

Tries the quick search; returns a dict of features

pyeo.core.do_saved_search(session, search_request)¶

Does a saved search; this doesn’t seem to work yet.

pyeo.core.activate_and_dl_planet_item(session, item, asset_type, file_path)¶

Activates and downloads a single planet item

Sentinel 2 preprocessing¶

pyeo.core.apply_sen2cor(image_path, L2A_path, delete_unprocessed_image=False)¶

Applies sen2cor to the SAFE file at image_path. Returns the path to the new product.

pyeo.core.atmospheric_correction(image_directory, out_directory, L2A_path, delete_unprocessed_image=False)¶

Applies Sen2cor cloud correction to level 1C images

pyeo.core.sort_by_timestamp(strings)¶

Takes a list of strings that contain sen2 timestamps and returns them sorted

pyeo.core.get_image_acquisition_time(image_name)¶

Gets the datetime object from a .safe filename of a planet image. No test.

pyeo.core.open_dataset_from_safe(safe_file_path, band, resolution='10m')¶

Opens a dataset given a safe file. Give band as a string.

pyeo.core.aggregate_and_mask_10m_bands(in_dir, out_dir, cloud_threshold=60)¶

For every folder in a directory, aggregates all 10m resolution bands into a single image and create a cloudmask from the sen2cor confidence layer

pyeo.core.stack_sentinel_2_bands(safe_dir, out_image_path, band='10m')¶

Stacks the contents of a .SAFE granule directory into a single geotiff

pyeo.core.get_sen_2_image_timestamp(image_name)¶

Returns the timestamps part of a Sentinel 2 image

Raster processing¶

pyeo.core.create_matching_dataset(in_dataset, out_path, format='GTiff', bands=1, datatype=None)¶

Creates an empty gdal dataset with the same dimensions, projection and geotransform. Defaults to 1 band. Datatype is set from the first layer of in_dataset if unspecified

pyeo.core.create_new_stacks(image_dir, stack_dir, threshold=100)¶

Creates new stacks with from the newest image. Threshold; how small a part of latest_image will be before it’s considered to be fully processed

New_image_name must exist inside image_dir.

TODO: Write up algorithm properly

pyeo.core.stack_old_and_new_images(old_image_path, new_image_path, out_dir, create_combined_mask=True)¶

Stacks an old and new image, names the result with the two timestamps

pyeo.core.stack_images(raster_paths, out_raster_path, geometry_mode='intersect', format='GTiff', datatype=5)¶

Stacks multiple images in image_paths together, using the information of the top image. geometry_mode can be “union” or “intersect”

pyeo.core.get_raster_bounds(raster)¶

Returns a wkbPolygon geometry with the bounding rectangle of a raster calculate from its geotransform

pyeo.core.get_raster_size(raster)¶

Return the height and width of a raster

pyeo.core.resample_image_in_place(image_path, new_res)¶

Resamples an image in-place using gdalwarp to new_res in metres

Geometry processing¶

pyeo.core.get_combined_polygon(rasters, geometry_mode='intersect')¶

Calculates the overall polygon boundary for multiple rasters

pyeo.core.multiple_union(polygons)¶

Takes a list of polygons and returns a geometry representing the union of all of them

pyeo.core.multiple_intersection(polygons)¶

Takes a list of polygons and returns a geometry representing the intersection of all of them

pyeo.core.write_polygon(polygon, out_path, srs_id=4326)¶

Saves a polygon to a shapefile

pyeo.core.check_overlap(raster, aoi)¶

Checks that a raster and an AOI overlap

pyeo.core.get_aoi_bounds(aoi)¶

Returns a wkbPolygon geometry with the bounding rectangle of a single-polygon shapefile

pyeo.core.get_aoi_size(aoi)¶

Returns the width and height of the bounding box of an aoi. No test

pyeo.core.get_poly_size(poly)¶

Returns the width and height of a bounding box of a polygon. No test

Raster/Geometry interactions¶

pyeo.core.pixel_bounds_from_polygon(raster, polygon)¶

Returns the pixel coordinates of the bounds of the intersection between polygon and raster

pyeo.core.point_to_pixel_coordinates(raster, point, oob_fail=False)¶

Returns a tuple (x_pixel, y_pixel) in a georaster raster corresponding to the point. Point can be an ogr point object, a wkt string or an x, y tuple or list. Assumes north-up non rotated. Will floor() decimal output

pyeo.core.stack_and_trim_images(old_image_path, new_image_path, aoi_path, out_image)¶

Stacks an old and new S2 image and trims to within an aoi

pyeo.core.clip_raster(raster_path, aoi_path, out_path, srs_id=4326)¶

Clips a raster at raster_path to a shapefile given by aoi_path. Assumes a shapefile only has one polygon. Will np.floor() when converting from geo to pixel units and np.absolute() y resolution form geotransform.

pyeo.core.get_aoi_intersection(raster, aoi)¶

Returns a wkbPolygon geometry with the intersection of a raster and an aoi

pyeo.core.get_raster_intersection(raster1, raster2)¶

Returns a wkbPolygon geometry with the intersection of two raster bounding boxes

pyeo.core.get_poly_intersection(poly1, poly2)¶

Trivial function returns the intersection between two polygons. No test.

pyeo.core.create_new_image_from_polygon(polygon, out_path, x_res, y_res, bands, projection, format='GTiff', datatype=5, nodata=-9999)¶

Returns an empty image of the extent of input polygon

pyeo.core.get_local_top_left(raster1, raster2)¶

Gets the top-left corner of raster1 in the array of raster 2; WRITE A TEST FOR THIS

Masking functions¶

pyeo.core.create_cloud_mask(image_path, model_path, mask_out_path, model_nodata=1)¶
pyeo.core.create_mask_from_confidence_layer(image_path, l2_safe_path, cloud_conf_threshold=30)¶

Creates a binary mask where pixels under the cloud confidence threshold are TRUE

pyeo.core.get_mask_path(image_path)¶

A gdal mask is an image with the same name as the image it’s masking, but with a .msk extension

pyeo.core.combine_masks(mask_paths, out_path, combination_func='or', geometry_func='intersect')¶

ORs or ANDs several masks. Gets metadata from top mask. Assumes that masks are a Python true or false

pyeo.core.apply_array_image_mask(array, mask)¶

Applies a mask of (y,x) to an image array of (bands, y, x), returning a ma.array object

Machine learning functions¶

pyeo.core.classify_image(image_path, model_path, class_out_dir, prob_out_path, apply_mask=False, out_type='GTiff', num_chunks=2)¶

Classifies change in an image. Images need to be chunked, otherwise they cause a memory error (~16GB of data with a ~15GB machine)

pyeo.core.reshape_raster_for_ml(image_array)¶

Reshapes an array from gdal order [band, y, x] to scikit order [x*y, band]

pyeo.core.reshape_ml_out_to_raster(classes, width, height)¶

Reshapes an output [x*y] to gdal order [y, x]

pyeo.core.reshape_prob_out_to_raster(probs, width, height)¶

reshapes an output of shape [x*y, classes] to gdal order [classes, y, x]

pyeo.core.create_trained_model(training_image_file_paths, cross_val_repeats=5, attribute='CODE')¶

Returns a trained random forest model from the training data. This assumes that image and model are in the same directory, with a shapefile. Give training_image_path a path to a list of .tif files. See spec in the R drive for data structure. At present, the model is an ExtraTreesClassifier arrived at by tpot; see tpot_classifier_kenya -> tpot 1)

pyeo.core.create_model_for_region(path_to_region, model_out, scores_out, attribute='CODE')¶

Creates a model based on training data for files in a given region

pyeo.core.get_training_data(image_path, shape_path, attribute='CODE', shape_projection_id=4326)¶

Given an image and a shapefile with categories, return x and y suitable for feeding into random_forest.fit. Note: THIS WILL FAIL IF YOU HAVE ANY CLASSES NUMBERED ‘0’ WRITE A TEST FOR THIS TOO; if this goes wrong, it’ll go wrong quietly and in a way that’ll cause the most issues

further on down the line.

Exception objects¶

class pyeo.core.ForestSentinelException¶
class pyeo.core.StackImageException¶
class pyeo.core.CreateNewStacksException¶
class pyeo.core.TooManyRequests(*args, **kwargs)¶

Too many requests; do exponential backoff
